Name: Fear God & Dread Nought: Jutland Form 10s
Description:
Jutland Forms provides From 10s for every ship that fought at that momentous battle. Using the latest harmonized game data and organized by squadron and division, it also includes the Jutland scenario extracted from the High Seas Fleet data annex.

Jutland Forms includes a new rules supplement bringing Fear God & Dread Nought more in line withthe harmonized rules standard by replacing chapter eight (damage) and the gunfire modifiers table.

Designed for the loose-leaf format, players can simply replace the old pages with new ones, bringing their rules up to FG&DN 1.1 standard. Jutland Forms is not a complete upgrade, but a quick and easy way to improve these two most important aspects of the game.
Families: Series: The First World War at Sea (Clash of Arms Games)

Name: Run-n-Gun Basketball
Description: Run-n-Gun Basketball is a light basketball card and dice game. Gameplay is streamlined by using mechanics which would keep the game moving at a fast pace. Unlike full-blown basketball tabletop games, players never have to look at charts and statistical data since all the information are found in the individual player cards. A much more simplified and quicker game but still captures the experience of playing the game of basketball wherein scoring, passing, blocking, faking shots, rebounding and stealing balls take place.

Name: Ciclos
Description:
From the Publisher:

Evolua também!
Estratégia e planejamento são fundamentais para vencer esses emocionante jogo.
Use de estratégia para escolher o melhor momento para evoluir e mudar de CICLO.
 1º CICLO:
Ganhe heranças dos terrenos e adquira conhecimento para se formar e escolher uma profissão.
2º CICLO:
Compre terrenos, invista em negócios, acumule dinheiro e patrimônio e se prepare para avançar para o ciclo final.
3º CICLO:
Avance e supere os desafios da VIDA e chegue ao final do ciclo com mais dinheiro e patrimônio e seja o grande vencedor.

Nós da PLAY, temos imensa satisfação de lhe apresentar o mais novo
lançamento de Jogos de Tabuleiro do mercado.

CICLOS é a Evolução dos Jogos Imobiliários e após anos sem
nenhum lançamento original de um Jogo de Tabuleiro, o CICLOS vem para revolucionar e revigorar esse importante nicho de mercado.

Nosso site:
www.playjogosebrinquedos.com.br
www.jogociclos.com.br

Com qualidade impecável, CICLOS não deixa a desejar ao ser comparado aos demais jogos de tabuleiro do mercado.


Roughly can be described as a monopoly-like game divided in 3 cycles (ciclos in Portuguese). On the first you struggle for inheritance and knowledge, struggling to find an career. On the second, you seek to buy land, invest in business, aiming to get money. On the final cycle you aim to overcome the challenges of life and become the richest player.

Translation of the publisher description:

"Evolve!
Strategy and Planning are essential to win this thrilling game.
Choose strategically the best moment to evolve and change to a new CYCLE (cycle = ciclo in portuguese)

1st CYCLE:
Win inheritance of the lands and acquire knowledge to graduate and choose a profession.
2nd CYCLE:
Buy land, invest in business, earn money and wealth and get ready to advance to the final CYCLE
3rd CYCLE:
Advance and overcome the challenges of LIFE and get to the end whit more money and wealth to be the great winner.

(...)

Our site:
www.playjogosebrinquedos.com.br
www.jogociclos.com.br

With flawless quality CICLOS doesn't fall back when compared with the other boardgames currently in market.

(From the translator: please note that this game is being released in Brazil, where the boardgame market consists mainly of "War", a simplified version of "Risk", "Monopoly", "Clue" and "The Game of LIFE". Only recently a few new titles have been released, but, still, the closest we have to modern games were "Hart an der Grenze" (which has been banished from market), "Sultan" (both from Brazilian authors), "Go Bluffing", and a "Diamond" clone, as far as I recall)

Name: Monopoly: Australian Football League
Description:
Australian Football League (AFL) version of Monopoly.

All 20 AFL clubs have been spread over the first 7 groups of properties. The two most expensive properties are the most important cups.

In order, from Go: Western Australia, The Allies, South Australia, Victoria, Collingwood Magpies, Fremantle Dockers, Melbourne Demons, Adelaide Crows, Richmond Tigers, Geelong Cats, St Kilda Saints, Hawthorn Hawks, Sydney Swans, Port Adelaide Power, Western Bulldogs, West Coast Eagles, Brisbane Lions, Essendon Bombers, Carlton Blues, Kangeroos, The Ansett Australia Cup, and Premiership Cup.

The Railroads are stadiums: MCG, Colonial Stadium, SCG, and Football Park.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Name: Ghost Stories: Chuck No-Rice
Description: Originally available as a PDF download from the Repos Productions website as an April Fool Joke, this promo card for Ghost Stories was handed out at GenCon 2009 at the Asmodee booth.  Chuck is a 5-red tao Wu Feng incarnation, who kills adjacent ghosts when he comes into play, removes one Qi from each monk in the column in front of him each activation, and provide no reward, other than his signature.

Name: Route Z
Description:
In Route Z players are trying to get a mini-bus down the road.  The bus is escorted by 6 cars.  Ahead of them are a horde of zombies, behind them the rumble of zombies on motorcycles.  If they can defend the bus long enough, a ritual being cast on the bus will destroy all of the zombies.

Route Z is a cooperative game.

From the game:
"The war was bad. One hell of an understatement, but it was nothing compared to what came next. Zombies. Sure, laugh it up. It’s easy to do when you are surrounded by your friends and not by a horde of putrid cadavers breathing rot down your neck.

If it had just been zombies we would have been fine. What is dead once can be made dead again; but these were puppets of evil humans, or rather, necromancers. They were using found magic to reanimate the thousands fallen during the war. Rumors spread that they had gotten a copy of the true Necronomicon but those were only rumors because we have the only real copy. Now we are fleeing for our lives with it in a battered school bus trying to incant the one spell that will send these blighted things back to whence they came. Our team is ragtag but our vehicles are fast. Hopefully they are fast enough to outrun the necromancers riding double on bikes: that’s right, they taught the damned things to ride Harleys."

Voting for the contest this game is in can be done:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/439899

Name: Off With Their Heads!
Description:
In this humorous game set in the world of Lewis Carroll's "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland" and its sequel "Through the Looking-Glass", players attempt to collect the characters from the stories by following the command of the Queen of Hearts: "Off With Their Heads!"

Using a line-up of characters from the stories, players attempt to collect the lead person in line. Bonus points are awarded for collecting certain sets of characters.

Players use action cards to manipulate the line to get the characters they want most.

This game is an homage to / re-implementation of Guillotine.

Name: Just One Die Soccer
Description:
Just One Die Soccer is a solitaire statistical, replay-oriented game on Soccer.
It is based on the comparison between the goal for and against for the two teams involved in the match, with several additional options (as random period of form, etc.).
After a few simple calculations, each game is resolved with a single die roll: so it is possible to replay a season in one sitting.
Basic game comes with rulebook, charts, Italian Serie A 200/2009, Swiss Superleague 2008/2009 and Austrian Bundesliga 2008/2009. More seasons and leagues soon to come.
Available directly from the designer (send an email to pumaye@virgilio.it or pumaye@gmail.com)
Also available through wargamedownloads.com

Name: Claustrophobia
Description: Claustrophobia is a fast-play rules system for science fiction corridor fights. It can be used with any miniatures and board sections and accommodates small and large groups.

Name: Empire: The Macedonian  Punic Wars, 350-150BC
Description:
A simple strategic level game for 1-4 players, simulating the struggle for dominance between Carthaginians, Romans, Macedonians and Persians/Parthians. It can be played as it is with very simple combat rules, or individual abttles could be played with miniature figures using your preferred rule set. The impact of Alexander, Hannibal and Scipio is emphasised.

This game was the Society of Ancients' early membership incentive game for 2009 and came with their magazine Slingshot in August 09, but is also available separately.
Families: History: Wars of Alexander the Great

Name: Eagles & Kings
Description:
A chess-style game with 20 pieces per side, secret / variable set-up. 2 players, ages 8 and up. Print-n-play.

Standard chessboard
40 pieces

Based on E. R. Burroughs' Chessmen of Mars' (Jetan). I made a set of the original game Burroughs used as a plot device for the book and quickly discovered the design was flawed - 99% of all games ended in a draw. Not much fun. As I changed and clarified the rules to make the game competitive and fun, I soon hit upon the idea of dropping the specialized board and introducing secret set-up.

No longer using the 10x10 square board, EAGLES & KINGS uses a standard chessboard. With 20 pieces per side, this leaves 4 pieces in the third rank. Set-up for each player is done in secret. This makes each game potentially unique, as each player can place any of his pieces anywhere within the first 3 ranks.

Everything needed to play EAGLES & KINGS can be found in the files section, and permission is given by the designer for print-n-play. The piece designs and rules are my own and copyrighted.

Name: Fünf neuartige Taktikspiele
Description:
5 different 2-player strategy games in one box.

In the box a 2 sided gaming board: one is a classic checkers 8x8 grid, the other is 9x9 grid with some fields randomly seperated with red lines (which do play a role in the Colix game).

The included games are:

Okta - 8 different pieces numbered from 1 to 8 have to be put together to a tower with the pieces increasing, so the 8 in the bottom and the 1 at the top. Pieces only move vertically or horizontally. 4 of the own pieces (the un-even numbers) start at the opposite side of the gaming board.

Super Okta - The same as Okta, but you play on the 9x9 side of the gaming board.

Uno - A kind of checkers variant, where the pieces are homogenically placed on the gaming board. Winner is the player who first eliminates his own pieces. Pieces move vertically and horizontally and are taken by moving over the own pieces diagonally.

Slalom - Small pieces have to be put in a way that they can be taken in 8 strokes by a bigger piece.

Colix - You play on the 9x9 side of the gaming board and the red lines can´t be crossed. Every player controls 3 colors (6 pieces of each color). Aim of the game is to eliminate one color of the 3 colors of the other player.

Name: Escalera
Description:
This game is played using a 50-card deck (naipes estilo español), with 4 suits: gold, swords, clubs, and cups (oro, espada, basto, y copa).  It could be played using all cards except the king in a regular deck, with the ace as 1, and using diamonds as gold.

The player with the 7 of gold plays first.  Players take turns (moving clockwise around the table) placing cards.  You can play a card one up or one down from any cards currently on the table (played on the 7 but leaving all cards visible), or you can play a 7 from a different suit to start another escalera (staircase) in a new pile.  If you can play, you must, otherwise you pass.

The object of the game is to play all of your cards.  At the end of each game, players with cards left in their hands receive 1 point per card.  When a player receives 15 points, that player is out of the game.  Once it is down to 2 players, the player with the fewest points wins (as the game is no fun with only 2 players, since you know what cards the opponent has).

Name: E-Lektor Quiz
Description: An enjoyable educational game, designed to encourage development of basic skills in young children. Contains 6 cards with 12 activities/games, from the fantastic world of Looney Tunes. Using the Magic Pen, Children can answer more than 150 questions ranging from Logic to Attention, Observation, Memory, Form, Colours, Quantities and Combinations. The electronic pen highlights every correct answer with a happy tune and coloured lights.

Name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Umenzi Tribesmen Reinforcements
Description: The Umenzi Tribesmen is the sixth faction for Battleground: Fantasy Warfare, the award-winning tabletop wargame in which cards, rather than expensive miniatures, represent your forces. The Umenzi Tribesmen draws inspiration from the great Zulu armies of earth as well as a cinematic take on Voodoo, adding a new level of magic to Battleground play. As with previous Battleground factions, the Umenzi Tribesmen is packaged in two decks. Starter decks include all the cards needed to play -- 18 units, the 30-card Command deck and two reference cards -- plus the basic rules. Reinforcement decks include 50 unit cards, including two types not found in the Starter, plus the advanced rules.
Families: Game: Battleground Fantasy Warfare (Your Move Games)

Name: Countryopoly
Description:
"Countryopoly combines the fun of a property trading game with instruments used in today's country music. Players start at the sign with the arrow and proceed clockwise. Players build houses and hotels and choose from the unique "Pick'n'Grin" cards meant to keep them grinning, or they may be forced to take a "Grin'n'Bear" card. They will need loads of luck for those. Players may accidently land on "Karaoke Korner." In that event they must proceed to sing their favorite country song. All other players must judge the performance and pay them what they think the performance is worth. "Karaoke Korner" may wish to be avoided! And watch out for the "Slammer!" Play Countryopoly with family and friends and find out how much fun it is! Traditional play or one hour version. 2-6 players, Ages 8 and up."

From the publishers website

Name: Triage
Description:
The Healthy Heart Hospital is a very busy place with constant patients coming into the Emergency Room. As the administration, you have to choose the best course of action for keeping the hospital running and healing the patients. Can you make the most efficient hospital?

Players make up the doctors and administration. If the players keep the hospital running in full force and heal enough people, they prove to be a great hospital administration and win the game; if not, they lose.

Name: Dungeon Derby
Description:
A free Print and Play fantasy labyrinth fighting game with RPG elements for 1-4 players.

Each player controls one character of one of eight different classes, which respawns if killed.  Players take turns moving and taking two different actions such as Attacking a monster or another player, Casting a spell (either from a spellbook or as a one-shot from a scroll), Picking up an object, Exchanging items in town, or Upgrading stats and Equipping items and skills.  After a player's turn, any nearby monsters move toward that player and attack if able.

The goal is to collect 5 points by picking up Flags and delivering them to the entrance and/or killing the Dragon.  Each time a player picks up a flag, more powerful monsters, a free item, and a flag are placed in the labyrinth.  The Dragon, by far the deadliest monster, spawns after a player collects 4 flags.

This game is "beta"; it has no art and the rules and rulebook are unrefined.  However, it is in a playable state, and the author will accept any feedback and incorporate suggestions into new versions.

Contains-
8 Characters
149 Tokens (flags, treasure, wounds, upgrades, mana, experience)
9 Dungeon tiles
235 Cards in two decks (113 weapons, armor, shields, headgear, boots, rings, mounts; 122 spells, skills, special actions, and minor items)
32 monster chits

Name: Virulant!
Description: Game plays in a large plastic petri dish (150mm). Each of the 2 players has 10 'spores.' Place your spores in the dish according to a couple of simple placement rules. Surrounded opponent spores can be knocked out of the dish. Be the first to place all of your pieces on the board.

Name: Lifeguard on Duty
Description:
Swimming pools can be very dangerous. You have been hired as a lifeguard. Each shift, the kids line up to get in and swim. As more children enter the pool, it is your duty to assign them safe areas to swim. If a child is paired up with a swim buddy, parents tend to reward you for taking care of their kids. When an area of the pool gets too full, kids get bored and leave. If there are a lot of kids playing in your area, you are considered to be a good lifeguard. If you help enough kids you will gain favor with the Boss. It is always good when the boss likes you.

Players take the part of lifeguards assigning buddies to the children entering the pool. They will choose the best area of the pool to guard, hoping the children will be happiest there. The Boss will reward the lifeguard who has the best reputation, allowing the lifeguards to rank up. If ranking to a level 5, that player wins.

Name: Vacation USA
Description:
In Vacation USA, players roll dice and move around the board to various locations. They may opt to take a vacation on any landmark site they land on, or hold their money in hopes of landing on higher point value sites later. Players also may purchase Insurance cards one at a time (one at the start of the game, one on landing upon a white state), and must draw Hazard cards on red states. Hazards cost money, but may be ignored with the proper insurance. Each player may also borrow $1000 from the bank up to two times in the game to cover expenses.

The object of Vacation USA is to be the first player to accumulate at least 2500 points without owing any money.

Vacation USA claims to be an "Educational Experience", aiding the players in learning about U.S. vacation sites.

Name: Columbia: the Next America Game
Description:
This appears to be a promotional item devised at the request of the Rouse Company. Centered on the planned community in Columbia, MD, this game offers players the opportunity, "to become a developer in the NEXT AMERICA, COLUMBIA." Players must accumulate wealth and property in order to win.

As with Monopoly, upon which this game is strongly based, "Columbia: the Next America" ends when all but one player goes bankrupt, at the end of a predetermined time, or, in a unique addition, "when the next feature comes on the cable."

The center photo for the game board, as well as the game box, feature an 1982 aerial view of Columbia, MD.

Name: BattleLore: Creatures
Description:
The long-awaited creature expansion was made available at the end of 2009. This expansion includes sculpts of the previously limited Earth Elemental (now billed as a Rock Elemental with new rules) and the Hill Giant (now a Wood Giant). Players can use the new rules for these creatures or use the old rules and complete their collection.

In addition, BattleLore: Creatures comes with a brand new sculpt: The Hydra!

Contents:

     8-page rules booklet, including 5 new adventures
     3 Creature figures:
         Wood Giant
         Rock Elemental
         Hydra, with six interchangeable head/neck pieces
    
     3 banners
     2 Landmark hexes
     7 Web tokens
     7 Poison tokens
     1 Conjure token
     1 Medieval Tactics card (Battle-Savvy troops)
     4 Creature Summary cards (including a Blue Widow Giant Spider card)
     2 Landmark summary cards


Expands:

     BattleLore

Name: BattleLore: Dragons
Description:
An expectant hush falls across the battlefield as the enormous, ancient serpent swoops out of the clouds. With a single breath, the dragon devastates its enemies and strikes terror into the hearts of all who behold it.

In the BattleLore: Dragons expansion for the BattleLore fantasy battles board game, the epic battle continues with completely new and terrifying combatants: Dragons.

BattleLore: Dragons features three new creature plastic miniatures: the Ice Drake, the Fire Dragon, and the Wood Wyvern, each with accompanying summary cards, and tokens. BattleLore: Dragons also includes a rulebook with four new adventures featuring the Dragons. Also included in this expansion are a card for the Troll figure (from the BattleLore: For Troll and Country expansion) as well as a Troll Bridge token.

Expands:

     BattleLore

Name: Judgment
Description:
Judgment is a board game created by Miles Ratcliffe and, although some thought by Chaos Publishing Ltd. has been put into to publishing the game, it is not due to be published any time soon.

'Prepare to step into a whole new fantasy world full of magic and adventure as you battle your way through your quests like never before.

On a distant world, far from our reach, there was land full of magic and prosperity; where the just had ruled over the corrupt for many a millennia. Now a great force has thrown this world into chaos, separating the land into eight domains, just as this great power has been divided. Ultimate power will be granted to the one who can control this incredible force; and, as the chaos has spread across this once prosperous land, the evil and corrupt have made their return - who will claim judgment!

Play as one of 16 characters as you try to collect the chaos fragments to either restore the world to prosperity or damn it to destruction.

Judgment can be played with 2-8 players as each player plays out their strategy trying to out-wit each opponent as they battle creatures, cast spells, collect gold and purchase wargear to claim all the chaos fragments and exact judgment on the world!'

Name: Four Card Drax
Description:
Four Card Drax is a card game that is played in the Battletech Universe and represents a poker game. Its picture cards are not counted towards the hand, but alter the value of the cards you have.
 There are 4 suits -- Kurita [red], Steiner [blue], Marik [purple], Davion [orange] -- consisting of 1-10, Lancer, Rifleman, and Regent.
The game is described in the House Marik Source Book, p. 120.

Name: Het Nieuw Vermakelijk Brandweerspel
Description:
It's like The Game of Goose. 
There are 50 blocks with pictures of the Amsterdam fire brigade. The player that reaches the headquartes of the Amsterdam Fire Department, in the middle of the board, wins the game.

Name: Plus and Minus (+ / -)
Description:
Collect the most or the least endangered species. The +/- dice decides. This will force you to do all kinds of twists and use all the tricks you have available to win the game.

You can choose 1 out of 4 endangered species as your species. Purpose of the game is to collect the most or the least of your species. It all depends on the +/- is a fun combination of luck, strategy and action.

Name: The Syllable Game
Description: This teaching game comes for early readers comes with rules for three different games using the three sets of cards in the game.  There are rules for competitive, solitare, and double-solitare.

Name: Die Schlange
Description: The game contains a very long snake (more than two meters?) which has to be assembled from tiles during the course of the game. Game starts at the tail, then proceeds in a Dominoes fashion (colors have to be matched). But the segments of the snake are not straight, instead the snake coils (overlapping is allowed). When no player can place another tile, the head of the snake is added. The player it points at is the loser and receives one point. The player with least points after a certain number of plays, wins.

Name: I Need A Sign!
Description:
We need an ambulance! Call the police! The building is on fire! A pipe is broken and the street is flooded. There is a blackout. The phone is dead. When will that letter arrive?
As the director-general of a public service department, you are responsible for sending service vehicles to the places where their help is required, but in a city without street signs, this might be close to impossible. Fortunately, the local government has launched a street addressing program, and as street signs are placed all around the city, giving directions will become easier.
Players collaborate developing the street addressing program, and compete to get the highest score by being the best at giving and following directions through the city.

Name: Ptolemy
Description:
Claudius Ptolemaeus, known in English as Ptolemy, was an astronomer who lived in Roman Egypt and was the author of several scientific treatises, three of which would be of continuing importance to later Islamic and European science. The first is the astronomical treatise is now known as the Almagest.
Ptolemy's model was geocentric and assigned the following order to the planetary spheres around the Earth, beginning with the innermost: Moon, Mercury, Venus, Sun, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Sphere of fixed stars.

In Ptolemy, two players compete for control over the Ptolemaic spheres in a series of trick-taking rounds.
The player who ends with more cards of a given suit gets the points corresponding to that sphere: 1 point for controlling the Moon sphere, 2 for the Mercury sphere, and so on up to 8 points for the Sphere of fixed stars. The player with most total points wins the game.

Name: Battle for Fallujah: April 2004
Description:
Battle for Fallujah is a solitaire wargame modeling the first Coalition offensive against the insurgent held city of Fallujah in April 2004, designed as part of an MA in War Studies at Kings College, London in 2008-2009.

As the coalition player, you must weigh up the costs/benefits of using the readily available heavy weaponry to support your two Marine infantry companies as they engage insurgents and local nationalist Iraqis as well as locate and capture the Insurgency's leadership versus the damage to your mission by the media attention of the battle.

You, playing as the coalition, have limited ground resources, but effectively unlimited air and artillery support, must decide whether to use the heavy weapons at your disposal to quickly destroy insurgent opposition. But you must weigh up the destruction caused with the political fallout from the images of a burning Fallujah being broadcast around the world.

The aim of the game is to capture territory from the insurgency, locate and destroy centers of resistance, capture local insurgency leaders and engage enemy forces in order to regain control of the city.

The game is still a 'work in progress' so any feedback would be greatly appreciated.

Name: Faster than light Soccer
Description:
FTLS is a game for two players, but you may also play it solitaire, if you add the special rules that moves the game toward the simulation replay market.
It is based simply on the average goals for and against of each team, but it adds several features that makes strategy really important (in particular the comparison of the tacticts used by the opponents).
With the advanced rules it adds features like top scorers, assistmen and the great importance of disciplinary sanctions (red cards and yellow cards) on the overall performance of each team.

Name: Clown Around
Description:
The player with the red pawn starts the game. Each player spins and moves the spaces shown by the spinner. When a player stops at as shoe-space the player has to move his pawn up or down the path indicated, while saying: 'Clown Around.'
If a player neglets to move his pawn or say 'Clown Around', before the other player moves, the playerloses a turn. At his next turn, the player continues moving along the path.
A player may not stop on a space that is occupied. Instead the player moves the pawn a space forward. When the plays nears the end of the path, the player must spin the exact number of spaces.

The winner is the first player arrives at the circus.

Name: Countryside and Village
Description: An American Adventure Game. "Explore the village lanes and country roads of an 1830s New England community. In this game based on old Sturbridge Village, you will take your "family" through four seasons of activity. Hazards and windfalls await you, as do opportunity and difficulty. Will you find yourself better off when accounts are reckoned come New Years Day? Find out by playing this educational and detailed game!" Countryside and Village takes you through four seasons of life in an 1830s New England community. Keep a careful ledger and good relations with your neighbors. The ups and downs of life come into play where tradition and the winds of change make each new year a challenge.

Name: 2D Yacht
Description: Played with 25 dice and 5x5 grid. Each die individually first rolled then placed immediately on open grid space and not relocated thereafter. Object: create scored five dice "hands" horizontally and vertically (10 hands total).

Name: Dice Town: The Indians
Description:
Give back their territories to the Indians and win their favor. The Indian Dice determines how the Indians will help you: The Shaman's Blessing can change the face of one of your dice, with the Ambush you force an opponent to revive one of his dice, with the Path of War you shadow the effect of a place, the Bodyguard will protect you a turn against theft ...

The General Store card "Fire Water" and the "Indian Dice" will be available for U.S. Gencon 2009 (13-16 August), Le Monde du Jeu 2009 (18-20 September) and Essen 2009 (22 -25 October).

Bruno Cathala has confirmed that this expansion will appear as part of a full Dice Town expansion, set for release in 2011.

Name: Igels: Harz IV
Description:
Harz IV is a freebee add-on to the game Igels. It was distributed during the Spiel 2006 and was also included in the magazine Games Orbit, printed by Pegasus Games.

The card is a reference to the social/unemployment benefit "Hartz IV" granted in Germany. Also, it is a word-play as the German word "Harz" means "resin" and this is were the card comes into play. Here is the card's text:

"Wer einmal in die Harzfalle tappt, kommt kaum noch vom Fleck. Harz klebt sofort vier beliebige Gegner zusammen, die in dieser Runde nicht mehr weiter gespielt werden können."

This translates roughly into:

Whoever falls just once into the resin(Harz)-trap makes hardly any headway. Harz immediately sticks together any four enemies, who cannot be played any further this turn.

The two cards Harz IV cards you get are simply shuffled into your standard card deck. They are of the "Unterstützungskarten" (support cards) type and can be played as any support card can in the support phase of any combat.

Name: Chaos Dwarfs of Deep Forge (fan expansion for Warhammer Quest)
Description:
Excerpt from the introduction of the Chaos Dwarf Roleplay book:
"Players are most likely accustomed to playing Warhammer Quest as one of the Warriors in the core game, or possibly as one of the expansion characters, such as the Wardancer, Imperial Noble or Pit Fighter, for example.  Similarly, players have also had access to official characters (meaning not characters created by fans) who are aligned with the forces of Chaos, in the case of the Chaos Warrior, or are at the very least unlikely to be seen as do-gooders, such as in the case of the Ogre.
If the players are so inclined they may forgo their usual characters with which they are accustomed, and take up a life of adventuring as a band of Chaos Dwarfs!"

The expansion rule book contains all the material necessary for players to adventure in the Warhammer world as Chaos Dwarfs (Dawi Zharr), working diligently to establish the city Zharr Grungron Ankor as the next great Dawi Zharr city.

Name: Unus Dies in Circo Maximo
Description: A game for 2 to 6 players, plus aedile (moderator) and iudex (referee in case of disputes), if desired. The game is designed for practice in Latin-roots-to-English-words.

Name: Wat is dat? Das Plattdeutsch-Spiel
Description:
A quiz about Plattdeutsch, a North German dialect. It's a cross between Taboo and Scrabble.

Contains:
240 Word cads from high and platt German 
120 Letter cards
1 Die
1 Rules booklet

Name: Bailout! The Game
Description:
Everyone starts off with the best intentions but greed has caused you to make risky investments. Before long, you are forced to realize all your bank is left with is worthless paper. Your only option is to undermine, outsmart and devour the competition and make it to Bailout Bank before they do.

This game has the appearance of a classic railroad style game with strategic and competitive game play.  Bailout! The Game is anything but an ordinary ride along the tracks. The banks must obtain a continual flow of debt and have greatest unsustainable losses in order to win the game.

Banks bombard each other with sales and acquisitions.  The transactions are a vital part of the game; every decision a bank makes can affect every other bank.  Banks try desperately to manipulate their stock holdings for their own benefit. If they are not careful there stock may fall into the hands of a rival or vise versa.  The continued interaction drastically changes the outcome of the game right up until the end.

Bailout! The Game: Made in America with partially recycled materials. This game has classic American styling. Perfect for family game night or playing with friends.

Name: Rock Fever
Description:
"YOUR TICKET TO THE HOTTEST NEW ROCK & ROLL GAME"

From the back of the box (which also doubles as the rule "book"):
Object: To be the first person to advance through the Rock Fever concert seating to the stage and receive a backstage pass.
COMPONENTS:    * 4 Rock Fever Manuals    * 4 Pawns    * 1 Game Board    * 1 Backstage Pass    * 1 Die (6 sided)

Name: Descent: The Sea of Blood
Description:
The Sea of Blood expansion allows players to take their Descent games to the high seas.

New board sections include large expansive ocean tiles with scattered islands, as well as large ship decks with additional tiles featuring ships' cannons.

The expansion includes an expansive overworld map featuring new sea areas and island locations to explore.

The expansion also features new sea journey rules and adventures, as well as equipment and treasure cards and additional tuck boxes for packing the game away during longer campaigns.
Families: Game: Descent – Journeys in the Dark

Name: Fire-ice-Slime
Description:
Fire-Ice-Slime is a very fast and simple, 2-player, 1 Treehouse game, similar to Rock-Scissors-Paper. Players attack each other with fire, ice or slime, with the more powerful attack type winning. Each attack type is represented by colours, and has both strengths and weaknesses.

Red pyramids represent Fire, 
Blue pyramids represent Ice and 
Green pyramids represent Slime.

Fire melts Ice freezes Slime smothers Fire.

Name: Bastogne or Bust
Description:
I designed BOB to be the last word on low to medium complexity Bulge games. I enjoy playing Bulge games but I never found one that satisfied me. So I decided to make my own.

BASTOGNE OR BUST is a single-map, regimental treatment of the Battle of the Bulge. This is a PLAYER'S game! Designed on purpose to be more of a warGAME than a simulation. It addresses a number of pet peeves of mine in regard to Bulge games I'd played over the years. Some of these issues include:

OFF BOARD MOVEMENT CHART [what happens to all those pieces that 'exit the map?']
STACKING POINTS [one of the greatest mechanics of all time - why don't designers use it more often?]
COMMAND & CONTROL [divisional bonuses for unit cohesiveness]
SUPPLY DIFFERENCES [different effects on ALLIES vs GERMANS]
INITIATIVE [essentially, the 5-1 column on the CRT is gone]
NO OVERRUN [squads held crossroads against regiments]
NO WEATHER RULES [weather is reflected in air support]
VON DER HYDTE [ALWAYS gets on the board]
STREAMLINED PLAY [I don't need water allocation points]

Referred to affectionately by wargamers as BOB, I like to refer to it as The World's Finest Bulge Game. All of the artwork was done by myself - including the counters which were hand drawn!

22" x 34" map [printed on four 11" x 17" cardstock sheets]
600 counters [printed on 2 sheets of 8.5" x 11" label paper]
2 OOB/OOA set-up sheets
1 OFF-BOARD MOVEMENT CHART
2 Player Aid Cards
1 example sheet

This is the original TERRAN GAMES dtp publication of BOB showcased at ORIGINS '94 in San Jose, not the TERRAN GAMES, INC. version published a year later with all new [gorgeous] graphics by Mark Simonitch.
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Chavo-poly
Description:
It's Monopoly with a chav twist. Spaces include - Scruffy Maisonette, Vandalise Bus Stop and V.D. Clinic - Apply cream twice a day.

Chav is a derogatory term applied to certain young people in the United Kingdom. The stereotypical "chav" is an aggressive teenager or young adult, who often engages in anti-social behaviour.

Name: Kugel Hupf
Description: Content: One hexagonal board with 61 hollows, 48 balls in 4 colours. There are three possibilities to move your balls: "creeping": move to an adjacent hollow; "hopping": jump over an other ball to the next free hollow; "eating": "hopping" plus removing the ball you jumped over. The first player, who fulfills the chosen goal (e.g. "build a line of five balls in a row" , "build a single group with all your balls") wins. There are nine goals = variants, in each variant you may use one, two or three of the moves described above.

Name: Affentennis: Die Doppelerweiterung
Description:
"Affentennis - Die Doppelerweiterung" is an add-on to the game "Affentennis". You can now play doubles.

To play "Die Doppelerweiterung" you need to own the base game.

Included in the extension is:


     One red bag which holds all the components
     Two monkey figures ("Äffle")
     Two small volley blocks
     Two markers
     one spare ball
     rules


Two players per side play along the basic game rules, there are also some extra rules to accomdate the two extra players.

Name: Barnum's Animals: Animal Crackers Game
Description:
"Fun and excitement for players of all ages FROM 4 AND UP!"

Another game in a giant Animal Cracker box, this one published by Cadaco not Mattel/Fisher Price.

Object: Be the first to move your four animals from the circus ring into your four cages.

No reading required, just spin and go. [Although one spinner wedge is marked: "Return one animal to ring if you have one" and another says: "Take one animal from any other player's cage and return it to ring."] The remainder of the spinner board is an inner and outer circle of animal pictures that match all the plastic figures (eight in each ring).

The board has 16 painted platforms (the round kind that the clowns roll in) forming the ring. Place all 16 animals on these dots.

On each side of the square board are circus wagons, each with cages for four different animals. Each player chooses their wagon from the gameboard. They will try to fill their wagon with the pictured animals.

The player spins and then may take either animal that they need (from the inner or outer circle) and put it on its matching cage in his/her wagon. If the player has neither animal he/she passes the spinner to the next player.

First to fill their wagon is the winner!

Components:

Full-color vinyl illustrated playmat 27" x 27"
16 hand-painted, non-edible molded plastic animal figures
1 animal spinner card

Name: Holli-Wut
Description:
It´s a party game about guessing famous people of "Holli-wut" (Hollywood) by their characersitics.
The active player draws a card: He keeps the name secretely and only gives the other players some basic informations of this person printed on the card. Then he characterizes this famous person by putting several markers on the board. While doing that the other players guess the name of the person. After a certain number of hints the active player may imitate the person or indicate a typical body part of the famous person. The player who knows the name first gains victory points.

Name: Highlights Hidden Pictures Game
Description:
"Search for hidden objects cleverly disguised within the 'Hidden Pictures' scenes. It takes concentration and a sharp eye."

This visual challenge includes 32 picture boards, 32 clue cards, 30 search cards, a timer, 100 plastic score chips, rules, and a storage insert.

Designed for kids 5 and older with two levels of play for different skill levels.

Name: 5 to Close
Description:
[from Publisher]

Teamwork is crucial in this exciting word game. Build words with your partner. The longer the better. But be careful! Unlocked words receive no points when the round ends. Use special cards to double or triple word point values or freeze opponent's words. A great game for groups and parties!

Best played with 4, 6 or 8 players in teams of two.

After dealing 7 cards to each player, each player attempts to make words with their cards (with help from their teammate when it's their turn - who sits opposite) No more than 5 active words can be in front of any player at any given time. A word can be frozen or "locked" (turned over face down) and no more letter cards can be placed on that word(s). Teams work together in creating more or longer words. The longer word, the more points. Always at the end of each player's turn, he/she draws back up to 7.

There are special card in the deck including Wild (any letter A-Z), Double and Triple cards the double and triple the value of those words, Freeze which can lock an opponents word and Unfreeze which unlocks your own word.

There are special instructions in the game for 2, 3, 5, or 7 players.

Name: PitLane
Description:
PitLane is a boardgame that simulates a Formula 1 race. The race is a sequence of game rounds, which are divided into planning and movement. It is a game where strategically planning your movements is essential. Every driver has his own deck of "movement cards" which include straight lines, curves, braking and overtaking cards. Each round you may pick up a maximum of 4 cards, in the order you wish to play them, you then move your driver's car according to the cards directions, around the track. But be careful, picking all 4 cards every time could result in collisions with other drivers, going off the track, or running out of fuel.

Before a race begins, you must choose your fuel load and tyre types according to different variables, such as weather conditions, where warmer temperatures result in quicker tyre wear, and also your fuel strategy, as you must choose your race fuel for qualifying. To make these decisions, you look at the various statistics on your driver's information cards, and place markers upon the starting fuel load, and reliablity statistics, which change over the course of the race.

Name: De Kaasroute
Description:
The players move with their pawn through Switzerland. each player gets six destination cards. The object is to chose the shortest way along the map and get back at the player starting point.
The game is very simular to A Journey through Europe. The cards give information about Switzerland.

Name: Power Grid: Transformer Station
Description:
Power Grid: Transformer Station (Funkenschlag - Umspannwerk) is part of the Power Grid: BGG Promo Card Set.

It was originally a limited edition card for Power Grid (aka Funkenschlag 2nd Edition) available for a donation at the Essen Spiel fair '09.

The Transformer Station is connected to a power plant and can supply an additional city.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Germany & France
Description: This double sided Age of Steam expansion combines the Germany expansion from Age of Steam Expansion - Western US and Germany and the France expansion from Age of Steam Expansion - Italy and France. It has color rules in both English & German.

Name: Settlements
Description:
Two groups of people decide to settle the same valley and become neighbours. They start to build houses, farms and markets. Little by little building small towns that will become great cities. As it is human nature these two human groups start competing for having the wealthiest city, the most productive farms, amazing monuments and the mightiest army.

Will you be a rich mogul or a powerful warlord? Will you do it by producing and selling or will your way be the way of the sword?

Take control of a small settlement and develop it into a mighty city estate!

You will need a d10 die to be able to play this game.

Name: Al-Andalus
Description:
Al-Andalus (Moors & Christians Wars) 
Introduction 
This game represents the fascinating history of the Iberian Peninsula in the era of so-called "second Taifa kingdoms" around mid-twelfth century. When the domain Almoravids began to fall, arose the second Taifa kingdoms (1144-1170), which were later conquered by the Almohades Arabs. In this period of time raised new Muslim kingdoms that fought with the Christian princes of the north. Muslim Spain bordered with the kingdoms of Portugal, Leon, Castile and Aragon. Fighting and looting was constant and borders and kingdoms were changed continuously. The players represent various Arab and Berber families who struggle for the conquest of Al-Andalus.

The players take roll of kings (emirs) who have small independent kingdoms called Taifas. Each player chooses a Muslim kingdom to start its expansion through Al Andalus conquering more provinces and increasing prestige. Prestige is obtained throughout the game by conquering and by developing Art, Culture and Science in the kingdoms. The player which get more Prestige at the end is the winner.

Components 
Board south of the Iberian Peninsula 
counters for armies, fleets, towers, castles and cattle, 
Colored markers for kingdoms 
50 cards of troops, 
40 cards of siege, 
30 cards of Christian kingdoms and Almohad 
30 cards of legacy (which combine leisure and culture, art and science). 
Special cards: kidnapping, ambassadors, spies, messengers.
Dinars in coins of 1, 2 and 5.

Al-Andalus ( Las guerras de Taifas)   
                                              Introducción
Este juego representa la apasionante historia de la Península Ibérica en la época de los llamados “segundos reinos de Taifas” en torno a mediados del siglo XII. Cuando el dominio almorávide empezó a decaer, surgieron los llamados segundos reinos de taifas (1144-1170), que fueron posteriormente sometidos por los almohades. En este periodo de tiempo surgieron nuevos reinos musulmanes que luchaban con los príncipes cristianos del norte. La España musulmana hacia frontera con los reinos de Portugal, León, Castilla y Aragón. La lucha y el pillaje era constante y las fronteras y reinos se modificaban continuamente. Los jugadores representan a diferentes familias árabes y beréberes que luchan por la conquista de Al-Andalus.
Objetivo
Los jugadores representan a reyes (emires) que tienen bajo su poder pequeños reinos independientes llamados Taifas. Cada jugador elige un reino musulmán para iniciar su expansión a través de Al Andalus. Gana el jugador que al finalizar la partida tenga mayor prestigio en el marcador. El prestigio se obtiene a través de conquistas y desarrollo cultural del reino.

Componentes 
Tablero del sur de la Península Ibérica
Fichas de ejércitos, torres, castillos y ganados,
Marcadores de reinos por colores
50 cartas de tropas, 
36 cartas de asedio, 
24 cartas de reinos cristianos y almohades  
30 cartas de legado ( que combinan ocio y cultura, arte y ciencia).
Cartas especiales: secuestros, embajadores, espías, mensajeros.
Dinares, en monedas de 1, 2 y 5.
Dados

Name: RolaSoccer
Description:
RolaSoccer is a game for all ages and is played as a team game - either between two or more players, or between two or more groups of players. Each group constituting a team. (from the rules)

RolaSoccer is a dice game with 6 dice. 
3 dice are movement dice "cubes" (Forwards, Midfield, Backs)
3 dice are incident dice "cubes" (Striker, Tackle, Goalkeeper)

Name: RolaTote
Description:
RolaTote is a game for turf enthusiasts and can be played by up to 6 persons - each owning a horse (or horses) and sponsering a race in turn.
The object of the gaame is to win the race by jumping an agreed number of Fences e.g. 
2 to 3 horse race: 5 Fences 
5 to 6 horse race: 4 Fences
7 to 8 horse race: 3 Fences

RolaTote is a horseracing dice game with 8 dice called cubes.

one soild blue CALL OVER cube
one START Cube (No. 1)
one RACE Cube (No. 2)
one FENCE Cube (No. 3)
one BAULK Cube (No. 4)
one MISTAKE Cube (No. 5)
one soild red WEIGH-IN Cube
one soild black STEWARDS ENQUIRY cube.

Name: Cranium Bloom: Let's Play Count & Cook Game
Description:
Cooking is magic. Grinning, giggling, I-can't-believe-I-get-to-help magic. This counting and matching game lets you and your child share the fun of cooking in and out of the kitchen.

Count your way around the board. Gather food for the recipes in your cookbook. Add your secret ingredients -- then pull the tab for something funny to do!

When you cook and play together, every moment is sweet.

What's in the box?
Let's Play Count & Cook Game includes the game board, 20 ingredient tokens, 4 chef movers, recipe book, and die.

Name: Drollinge-Quiz
Description: Children's quiz in which the kids have to decide which of three different answers is correct. Depending on the color of the square they are on, they can move forward or backward afterwards. First player to reach a finish line wins.

Name: Cranium Bloom: Let's Play Neighborhood Memory Game
Description:
Every neighborhood is full of memories just waiting to be made. Delight in these everyday discoveries with this puzzle memory game.

Put the bird inside the fire truck. Is it a match? Look, how silly! Let’s try again and look for the nest...

Pop center pieces into frames to make matches and create the perfect moment together, with lots of giggles along the way.

What's in the box?
Let's Play Neighborhood Memory Game includes 24 colorful, interlocking pieces

Name: Cranium Bloom: Let's Play Neighborhood Sounds Bingo Game
Description:
A bird tweet tweets and Dad’s lawn mower vrooms. Explore the sounds of your neighborhood with this new way to play bingo together.

Listen to the sounds on your bingo player. What do you hear? A tricycle bell? A puppy’s bark? Find the picture match on your bingo card.

There’s a symphony of sounds all around -- the perfect soundtrack for a play-and-share moment.

What's in the box?
Let’s Play Neighborhood Sounds Bingo Game includes the bingo player, 4 double-sided bingo cards, and 36 tokens.

Name: Einmal um den Häuserblock
Description: This game aims at telling children how to behave in traffic. The game board is unusual: When set up, it is an actual (three-dimensional) house with sidewalks around it. Players move around with die rolls. Some squares they land on give special moves or make you lose a turn. First player who makes it around the block is the winner.

Name: Cranium Bloom: Let's Play Sandwich Stacker Cookout Game
Description:
Let’s Play Sandwich Stacker Cookout Game is pretend-food fun plus a match-and-stack game—in one! Players take turns using the menu spinner and matching what they spin to an ingredient to add to the silly sandwich. Or they can pile on favorite ingredients to make a special sandwich all their own. It’s a recipe for serving up smiles!

What's in the box?
Let’s Play Sandwich Stacker Game includes a menu spinner, storage bag, and 12 stackable play-food pieces.

Name: Cranium Bloom: Let's Play Sandwich Stacker Lunchtime Game
Description:
Let’s Play Sandwich Stacker Lunchtime Game is pretend-food fun plus a match-and-stack game—in one! Players take turns using the menu spinner and matching what they spin to an ingredient to add to the silly sandwich. Or they can pile on favorite ingredients to make a special sandwich all their own. It’s a recipe for serving up smiles!

What's in the box?
Let’s Play Sandwich Stacker Game includes a menu spinner, storage bag, and 12 stackable play-food pieces.

Name: Cranium Bloom: Let's Play Shop & Match Game
Description:
Bakery scents tango with red ripe mangos. Shopping carts wiggle-jiggle down the aisles. Share in the fun of exploring the grocery store with this sort-and-match game.

Find bananas, macaroni and cheese... all the foods on your list. Beep your scanner as you fill up your grocery basket.

It's a treasure hunt for your favorite foods -- and what you'll find are magical moments together.

What's in the box?
Let's Play Shop & Match Game includes the grocery store game board, grocery basket, 16 play food pieces, scanner, spinner, 8 reusable grocery lists, and erasable pen.

Name: Napoleon's Grande Armee
Description:
Richard Berg follows up Chainmail: Medieval Combat with NAPOLEON’S GRANDE ARMEE. The game will use the Chainmail card system to recreate four exciting battles that follow one of the greatest military leaders of all time. No dice and no charts. The battles included will be Austerlitz, Lutzen, Wagram, and Ligny. The game will include a map, counters, rules, and cards.

The game uses cards, one deck for each player (whose cards are somewhat different from those of the other player) to drive the game. Each player gets a certain number of cards each turn - but never his full deck. The cards are used to determine movement, combat, and actions. is thus a game of card play and management, which unfolds on the historical battle map - it uses squares, rather than hexes with the use of some beautiful, super-size counters. No dice are used. And there are no CRT’s. Skill determines the outcome.

Name: Full Sail: Fleet Actions in the Deep Ocean
Description:
Full Sail: Fleet Actions in the Deep Ocean recreates naval battles in the Age of Sail.  Made with ease of play and minimal record keeping in mind, Full Sail is geared for naval enthusiasts wanting a lighter, but fun game.

Ships are broken into 1st-6th rate rankings.  Initiative is a simple, yet efficient dice mechanic.  Movement, which is based on the initiative roll, is easily learned and accounts for wind, ship direction and ship size.

Games can range from a single ship per side to 4-5 ships per player without bogging down.  Both historical and non-historical scenarios can be played using this rule set.

Full Sail is based on Brother Aelred Glidden's As Per Margin III rules found in the May/June 1999 #99 issue of Midwest Wargamers Association Newsletter (MWAN). Full Sail includes initiative, wind direction/speed and campaign rules as well as ship record sheets not included in the original rules.

Name: Missionary Blues
Description:
Missionary Blues is a card game similar to Crazy Eights. The cards all have a Mormon Missionary Theme. Players must match the top card of the discard pile with either the same suit or a matching number. Whenever a player changes suit, either by number or one of the wild cards, s/he collects a Letter from the Mission President Card, which has a point value. At the end of the game, the player with the highest point total wins.

Special cards that cause opponents to Draw Four, Reverse play order, and discard all cards of one color are included and have artwork relevant to Mormon missionaries such as Zone Leaders, APs, and a "Little Devil" - which can bounce the power of a negative card back to the player.

Name: Planet X: Terror from Across the Universe
Description:
Planet X: Terror from Across the Universe is the first supplement for Fantastic Worlds: Pulp Action in the Far Reaches of Space.

Players can now choose from many different alien ‘skins’ for their characters, allowing them to play anything from a lizard man to a cephalopod. Aliens with strong mental powers exert their will over weak minded characters using the new psychic skills and attributes. Players can even use hive mind creatures as player models.

No pulp sci-fi story or serial was complete without a wild and deadly creature for the hero to face. Pulp authors let their imaginations loose on these fabulous monsters, creating creatures of every size and shape imaginable, many with abilities that would challenge any hero. Planet X has a generic set up that allows players to use any creature model in their collection, creating a virtually inexhaustible supply of challenges.

Along with the rules for creating your own aliens, we have included information on some of the races and creatures that inhabit Planet X; from the strange hive minds of The Calanti to cyborg enhanced Rhonijn to the limb-rending Ripper Beast.

Then, to get you started quickly, we have 2 multi-part scenarios already done for you. One pits Kip, Sarah, Dr. Litmus and their allies against the psychic Zzinn in The Psychic Lords of Planet X. The second has a Star Command vessel investigating a mysterious floating wreck in The Chronicles of Star Command - Derelict.

88 Pages

Expands:

     Fantastic Worlds

Name: Sticks & Stones Card Game
Description:
Sticks & Stones is a card game romp through a prehistory that time forgot. Players control one of four clans struggling for survival and dominance at the dawn of humanity. To win, you’ll have to use everything you’ve got: shamanic powers, mighty beasts, brutal weapons, cunning inventions, shiny rocks, diplomatic grunts, threatening stares, and more! Just remember no talking during your turn!

Each player assembles a clan of archaic Homo sapiens, Dino sapiens, Neanderthals, or Troglodytes. Archaic Homo sapiens are our primitive ancestors. They are physically weaker than their rivals, but make up for it with character types that include the nimble Florz (cave halflings) and Cave Nerds (who create amazing prehistoric "technology"). Dino sapiens are semi-intelligent dinosaur people who enlist fierce dinosaurs as their allies. Neanderthals have brawny fighters and shamans who use powerful magic. Troglodytes are the most primitive clan (making even Neanderthals look civilized) but have fearsome creatures like Trogres and the dreaded Dragonasaurus working for them.

Sticks & Stones is a 2-4 player card game. There are 110 cards, including characters from each clan, Woot! cards (events, gear, and special items), and Quest cards (challenges faced by your clan). An optional 5th player can serve as the Cave Master for the game. Players must resort to prehistoric roleplaying as they bluff, intimidate, and cajole each other--all without speaking during their turn!

Name: Larry Lasso
Description:
Each cowboy takes up his lasso. The first player throws both colour dice. Now, all players try to catch the bandits matching the colour(s) of the dice with their lassos and to pulling the bandits to their jail at the corner of the board.
Throw your lasso from the edge of the game board in the direction of the bandits. When throwing the lasso, you may not hold your hands or the lasso over the board.
A bandit is counted as caught as soon as he stands completely on the jail. The player removes the lasso and places the bandit in front of him. The player may try to catch more bandits right away. When all bandits with matching colours are caught, it is time to pay the reward.

Name: Route et Vélodrome
Description:
French cycling game from the '60s about the Tour de France. The game board measure 41 x 32.5 cm, goal is to reach Paris first

From : http://users.telenet.be/wielerbordspellen/spellen/spel131/spel131%20-%20engels.htm
"Replica of the old game “Jeu de Touristes et Jeu de Vélodrome that was originally published around 1910 by Saussine in Paris. This replica has appeared in the French cycling magazine Miroir de Cyclisme number 112 of April 1969. The magazine has the dimensions 34 x 26.5 cm, the game board measure 41 x 32.5 cm. Mirroir the Cyclisme have appealed to the collection of Rene Geslin to bring out this reprint. In the course of years, several versions of this game have been published. For example one with the name “Tour the France Cycliste “ in the Fifties.

It is a simple game of goose where a cycling game is played along the outer track of the game board and on the other hand a (initially) tourist car game on the track with the map of France. In the original game cyclists, small cars and bonus cards were provided.

Whit this version comes only the game board and the game rules.

In the version of the years ' 50 the layout of the game board has been preserved, but the characters and symbolism has been adapted to the era. Also the rules have been strongly simplified. In the original game bonus points could be deserved at stage wins, this has been completely deleted from the rules and everything has been reduced to a simple game of goose.".

Name: Panzer Grenadier: West Wall
Description:
West Wall is a supplement for the Panzer Grenadier series of games, with 10 scenarios based on the battles around the city of Aachen in late 1944. West Wall includes just this booklet; you'll also need to use boards and pieces from Battle of the Bulge, Elsenborn Ridge and Road to Berlin games and some pieces from our Cassino '44, Beyond Normandy and Afrika Korps games.

West Wall is sold BOTH via .pdf download and as a printed booklet.

Name: Formula Dé: Laguna Seca
Description:
A fan made expansion map for Formula De based on the Laguna Seca Raceway. The file for the map is currently located in the Formula De file section here: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/fileinfo/34328.

Designers note: At the time I designed this track, I didn't realize that there was already one available based on this course (Monterey). So, I'd suggest you go ahead and try and find a copy of the original track. It wasn't my intention to remake any course that had already been published.

Name: Formula Dé: Lime Rock Park
Description: This is a fan made expansion course for Formula De based on the Connecticut race track of the same name. The files for this track can be found in the file section of Formula De here: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/filepage/43068.

Name: Instant Bandits
Description:
Fast play air-to-air combat miniatures game for WWII planes similar to the game Instant Thunder. The game uses a rectangular grid with playing card suits marking 4 rows and cards K to A marking 14 columns.

Planes have individual flight characteristics for vertical and lateral movement, as well as armament and structural points.

Each turn a card is drawn for each plane to place it onto the grid on the appropriate space. Planes may be able to move to a different space by drawing a new card that must be lower than its movement rating. Thereafter shooting is performed in a similar fashion. At the end of each turn, the planes are removed from the grid, so may reappear on an entirely new angle of attack the following turn.

Rules provide many optional rules and very complete aircraft statistics.

Name: 'Ere We Go: Orks in Warhammer 40,000
Description:
A supplement to the orginal Warhammer 40,000 Rogue Trader. Provides new rules for such things as Painboyz, After the Battle, Runtherdz, Boars & Cyboars, How to Paint Your Ork Warband, Weirdboyz, Madboyz, Ork Mekaniaks, Kustom Vehicles, Vehicles, Robots, Weapons and Wargear, Shokk Attack Gun, Kustom Weapons, and lots of fluff.

208 pages plus cards.

Name: Firlefanz
Description: This game consists of 25 letter tiles and five sets of rules. The basic concept is to put all tiles face-down on the table and start flipping them over, forming words from the open letters. The variants add a memory aspect, cross-word laying and also a cooperative game in which all players try to form a word using the last opened letters.

Name: Fuchs und Gans
Description:
There are six forests, consisting of three trees each. One of the 18 trees has a little hole at the bottom, the object of the game is to find that tree. 
The players roll a die and move their wooden foxes towards the trees. The die contains the numbers 2-5, a goose and a tree. The tree means that two trees can be swapped without looking under them; the goose means that the player can secretly check out one tree. 
To win the game, a player must move on the one square directly in front of one of the forests, pick up a tree and find the hole in it.

Name: Dachshund Races
Description:
(From the website)
They're short, they're long, they're Dachshunds and they are ready to race.  Be the first to cross the finish line, but beware of loose treats, stray cats and the urge to stop and lick your paws.

Roll the dice and move the lowest of your rolls, but beware, if you roll all of the same number, you stop to lick your paws.  Use rockets and robolegs to speed up your dachshund or drop treats or peanut butter to slow down your opponents.  Do you have what it takes to win three races and take the glory?

Includes:

* Dachshund Races Board
    * Dachshund Racers Deck (6 cards)
    * Upgrade Cards Deck (60 cards)
    * Rules Document
    * 1 Joystick Pawn - Blue
    * 1 Joystick Pawn - Red
    * 6 D6 (16mm) - Bone
    * 1 Wink (3/4" | 19mm) - Green (~40 ct)
    * 1 Wink (3/4" | 19mm) - Green (~40 ct)
    * 1 Joystick Pawn - Yellow
    * 4 D10 (22mm) - Random Color
    * 1 Joystick Pawn - Brown
    * 1 Joystick Pawn - Purple
    * 1 Plastic Bags - 3"x4"
    * 1 Joystick Pawn - Green

Name: Homecoming Audition
Description: If you think you know southern gospel music trivia, gather your friends around the game "Homecoming Audition: Will You Be There?"  The winner is the first one to arrive - via bus- at the Gaither Studios for a Homecoming audition.

Name: Mogadishu, Somalia, 1993
Description:
Designed as part of an MA course in War Studies with King's College London, this game covers the battle in Mogadishu on 3 Oct 1993 between US forces and Somali militia.

The game begins at about 4.20 p.m., after Black Hawk Super 61 was shot down, and the US must then extract themselves with their prisoners and the US helicopter crew, while the Somalis aim to prevent that.

Availability: www.kcl.ac.uk/schools/sspp/ws/consim.html
Price: FREE

Name: Count Down
Description: A number-based version of Mastermind with a rocket countdown theme. The system doesn't use power, but has a set of rotated cylinders used to show the challenger's selection, and another set of cylinders alongside to show the number of correct digits.

Name: Killpower Ball
Description:
Developed over 18 years, Killpower Ball is a board game, futuristic sports in which your role is that of a coach of a team of seven warriors. They are equipped with magical powers.  In a completely closed room, like a basketball court and under the rules of handball and inspired gladiator fights, you need to score a winning number of points against the opposing team or the massacre.

Players can play in a tournament mode or championship and manage a team throughout their coaching careers.  A player's 7 gladiators can evolve and become increasingly powerful.

Killpower Ball is primarily a game for two, but a third player may act as an arbitrator / referee.  Win games and lead your team to the leading position.

Released in France in January 2010

Name: Make an Offer
Description:
As a real estate entrepreneur one must aggressively make offers greater than your opponent in order to obtain the best properties available at the best price.  However, the property value of any particular home depends upon the properties around it.

In this two person card game of property acquisition each player must offer an amount for a property greater than their opponent.  If successful, the player with the greater offer receives the value assigned for the property based upon its adjacent property.

The person with the most points after three rounds wins and earns the title of Master Entrepreneur.

The game consists of 48 total cards.

24 "Offer Cards"
24 "Property Cards"

There are 8 unique Offer Cards marked $10,000, $20,000, up to $80,000.  There are three of each denomination.

There are 4 unique Property Cards.  There is a Mansion, a Ranch, a Trailer, and a Cardboard Box.  There are six of each type of Property.

In addition to the standard game rules I have include two different variations (Blind Man's version and Blind Man's Bluff version) in the rules that can be played to increase the difficulty of the game.

Name: Quest: A New Age
Description:
In Quest: A New Age, the purpose of the game is to take your Adventuring Party into each Dungeon and attempt to complete your assigned Quest Objective.  This can be done as a Solo player or with any number of players controlling and arguing over the party members.  (I have run one of my D&D groups through it with 8 people as the party)
Your Adventuring Party is made up of 5 Unique and Specific Classes that must be represented as you begin the game.  Each class has a Hero that Begins at Level 1 and can advance up to Level 5 during game play.  Most 1st level Heroes need 3xp to advance to level two. 7xp more to advance to level three, 10-15 more to level four, and 18-24 to level five. This depends on the class and individual Hero.
Here is a list of the 19 Heroes that we have at this time and what they are at each level.
Protection Class:
Griff - Journeyman - Fighter - Warrior - Barbarian - Berserker
Sonya - Wanderer - Explorer - Questing - Paladin - Angel
Olli - Son of Hamfast - Pikeman - Squire - Knight - Crusader
Solarion - Footman - Swordsman - Lieutentant - Captain - General
Death Class:
Selene - Outlaw - Bandit - Thief - Rogue - Shadow
Gabriel - Urchin - of the Streets - Minstrel - Bard - Muse
Grimm - Outlaw - Bandit - Enforcer - Assassin - Reaper
Sabban - Rebel - Renegade - Deciever - Deserter - Betrayer
Nature Class:
Richard - Farmer - Woodsman - Guide - Scout - Ranger
Isseili - the Fey - Forester - Naturalist - Druid - Warden
Venr - Awakened - Scavenger - Hungering - Feasting - Vampire
Magic Class:
Marteel - Novice - Adept - Wizard - Mage - Archmage
Callius - Novice - Adept - Cultist - Warlock - Demon
Zaphian - Underling - Adept - Sorcerer - Necromancer - Lich
Rymar - Stonehead - Preserved - Protected - Encased - Fortified
Life Class;
Dana - Follower - Acolyte - Healer - Priestess - High Priestess
Jesse - Follower - Acolyte - Brother - Preacher - Martyr
Sarah - Searching - Enlightened - Forgiving - Redeemed - Guardian Spirit
Mary - Acolyte - Cleric - Devoted - Blessed - Saint

The Adventure consists of a 60 card Dungeon, which has one Quest Objective, Terrain, Creatures, Equipment, Effects, Fast Effects, Events, and other Items.  There are always two Unigue Tier Creature Cards that can be interchanged after completion of each Tier to make the adventure last longer and become more difficult.  The eight Adventures that we have complete are listed below with the amount of games played, completion rate, and Quest Objective.
Goblin Kingdom -    71/120     60%    Goblin King
Dead Marshes -      58/90       63%    Lord of the Undead
Demonic Rift -          35/63       54%    Balor              
Ruby Mountain -      31/64       49%    Ancient Red Dragon
Forsaken City -        25/51       50%    King of the Streets
Nature's Abundance 23/50      46%    Ancient Treant
Dangerous Seas -    21/47       38%    Captain Davy Jones
Tomb Kingdom -      17/50       34%    Tomb King
We are planning on a total of 10 adventures to become available in the future.
        
Game-play:
In Quest: A New Age there are Abilities, Upgrades, and four stat Values -- Accuracy, Armor, Life, and Damage. 
Abilities differ for each Hero and Creature according to their assigned value in the game, (e.g. a Goblin Recruit has no abilities and is worth 1 point value, while a Goblin Captain has a value of 3 and grants abilities to other Goblins).
5 levels of Upgrade are available to each Hero and are earned in the Dungeon as the party delves deeper into the adventure. As you gain XP from Terrain, Trap, and Creature cards, you can spend the XP to make your Heroes stronger. 
Accuracy is the Hero or Creatures base accuracy which you then combine with a roll of a D20 to attempt to hit.
Armor is the Hero or Creatures base defense against attacks.
Life is the Hero or Creatures base damage that they can take before dying.
Damage is the Hero or Creatres base damage they can inflict against another.
 Phases of the Game:
1)  Quest Deck - Turn over the appropiate amount of cards.  Fast Effects happen at this time and can change how many cards are turned over.
2)  Effects - Any Effects that are turned over happen at this time.
3)  Hero1 - All Heroes have one action per turn, which can be used to either Attack, Heal, Pick Up and item or attempt to Disarm a trap.  The Hero may also Hold their action for Hero2 phase.
4)  Dungeon - Any surviving Creatures may perform one action at this time.
5)  Hero2 - The Heroes that held their action can now act.
6)  Events - Events such as traps that have not been disarmed and other Events take place at this time.
7)  End of Turn - End of Turn abilities such as Regenerate and Aura's take place at this time.
8)  Upgrade - XP that has been collected can now be used to upgrade your Heroes.  When a Hero is upgraded they gain full health.  Once XP has been spent on a Hero, it cannot be used again.
Start the Phases over at this time.
 The game begins by shuffling your Quest Deck and turning over three cards.  As the game progresses and your Heroes are upgraded, you start to turn over more cards to make the Adventure more difficult.  The Breakdown is as follows:
Game Begins - 3 Cards per turn
After Two Hero Upgrades - 4 Cards per turn
After Five Hero Upgrades - 5 Cards per turn
After Eight Hero Upgrades - 6 Cards per turn
After Ten Hero Upgrades - 7 Cards per turn
After Twelve Hero Upgrades - 8 cards per turn
 Rules Questions:
1)  When Attacking you take the Accuracy and add a D20 roll. That roll must equal or beat the targets Armor.  You do not have to roll when Healing or using an Ability unless it is used as an attack.
2)  Melee characters cannot target Ranged characters unless all other Melee opponents are defeated.
3)  Rolls of a 1 are considered an Epic Fail and always miss.  Rolls of 20 are considered a Critical Strike and always hit, in addition a Critical causes Double damage to the target.
4)  All XP this is collected goes into a community pool which can be used at the direction of the Party's controller or controller's.
5)  As an overall rule: The Cant's outweigh the Can's

We did a short Demo on youtube which is quite boring but you are free to take a look at the mechanics of the game. :)
http://www.youtube.com/user/HiddenKeep#play/all/uploads-all/1/hDXivVltVB4

Name: Preventit
Description:
The first-aid and safety game for all ages.
"Pick a playing piece and race your opponents around the outer board to enter the wheel. Everyone gets the chance to be "Question Master" and take charge of the time buzzer."

From the start square players roll the dice and move. The player is asked a safety or first-aid question related to the topic of the square they land on. A timer is started once the question has been read and the answer must be given before the timer sounds.

Once a player has completed the external track on the board they enter the central area and then must answer questions based on the spinner result. If answering successfully the player gets to point to one PREVENTIT lettercard of any opponent. If it is the correct colour they add it to their scorecard. If it is not the correct colour the lettercard remains face-down in front of the opponent. In either case play passes to the next player.

Win: The first player to fill their PREVENTIT scorecard wins.

Name: Gefahren erkennen
Description: There is a large map which shows 16 situations in traffic. In seven cases the people are acting correctly, in nine they do wrong. During the course of the game, kids have to put puzzle pieces onto the map to complete the situations. This game is aimed at the very young, and after a few rounds they will know the correct location for each puzzle piece.

Name: The Truth Hurts!
Description:
"A totally frank look at yourself."
"The world's most personal game."

Win: First player to get 3 Red Cards is the winner. A Red Card is won by fooling the other players into thinking you are lying when you are, in fact, telling the truth. Or vice-versa.

Play: A player spins the "category indicator" and is asked the first question, by any opponent, from the top card in the correct category's pile. The player decides whether to lie or tell the truth. S/he slides a "Truth" or "Lie" card forward, face-down, and then answers the question. The opponents then ask the remaining questions on the card and any further questions until they are sure that all necessary information has been given. The opponents must then decide if the player is lying or telling the truth and announce a "group decision". The truth or lie card is then turned face-up. If the group has been tricked the player wins 1 Red Card.

Contents: 
200 multiple question cards in categories of Relationships, Personal, Business and Childhood.
Truth and Lie cards
Red strike cards
Question category indicator

Name: Geisterfahrer
Description: Players circle a highway with their four cars. But there are two black cars who are wrong-way drivers. When a car hits one of them (they can be moved by the players, too), that car is out. The player with most "surviving" cars after a round wins.

Name: Gut geteilt ist halb gewonnen
Description: Very simple math game. There is a stack of cards with numbers on the table. Players roll two special dice and have to perform division or multiplication of the top card of the stack. If they succeed, they discard a card onto the stack, if they fail, they draw one.

Name: Heritage
Description:
Win: Reach the middle of the board and answer a question correctly.

Play: Players move forward the number shown by the thrown die. A question is asked from the category of the square they land on - Scenic, Kill, Waterhole, Soil Erosion, Drought, Fire, Flood or Hide. A penalty plastic disc is placed in the "Snake Pit" for a wrong answer. On the 3rd wrong answer the player moves directly to the "Snake Pit". Other penalty squares also exist.

When a corner square is landed on a  "You have made a reservation" card is acquired. On the 5th corner square landing a player moves towards the middle of the board. The exact number must be thrown to land on the middle square.

Contents:
1 Game board
1 Die
500 question and answer cards
24 "You have now made a reservation*" cards. (* A wild-life reservation)
6 animal player tokens
12 plastic discs

Name: Pöbbarölt í Reykjavík
Description: A drinking game where players try to collect bar-cards of which there are only six, two for each of the three pubs on the playing board. Players must solve the challenge on the bar-card to receive the card. When players land on other spaces on the track they have to follow the instructions (allowed to go to the bathroom, roll again, draw a card and so on).

Name: Project: Last Hope
Description:
Project: Last Hope is a game for up to 12 players, playable in 2-4 hours. The game is set on the world of Aquea, whose inhabitants have suddenly found themselves forcibly bound together in order to save themselves from a terrible new threat that has, by all appearances, emerged from another world to consume theirs.

Each of the players commands a mighty orbiting warship from which they deploy strike teams to the planet's surface in order to repel attacks, secure resources, construct fortifications and – hopefully – assist in breaking the siege (even if only temporarily).

Players will have to strike a balance between acting altruistically to assist their fellow players in repelling the invaders and acting in self-interest so that they not only survive but emerge a major power in the world.

Name: Jericho
Description:
A tower building game, very similar to Jenga.

The tower consists of 48 wooden rectangular bricks, instead of 54, and 5 of them have a hole in the middle, where marbles can be put. The only change in rules is you must catch marbles before they hit the ground or you lose your next turn.
